vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityReason: The function uses block.timestamp to generate a pseudo-random number, which can be influenced by miners. By manipulating the mining timestamp, a miner can affect the outcome of the randomness calculation, potentially leading to biased results in game or bet outcomes.
vulnerabilities.potentialSecurityRisk: A malicious miner could manipulate the timestamp to ensure their transaction wins during betting, gaining an unfair advantage and compromising the integrity of the random selection process for determining winners.
vulnerabilities.fixedCode: function _random() private view returns (uint8) { uint256 randomSource = uint256(keccak256(block.difficulty, block.number)); return uint8(randomSource % 2); }
